newsitem.title: USA: Strawberries Inc files for Chapter 11.
newsitem.headline: Strawberries Inc files for Chapter 11.

text.p: Software distributor Strawberries Inc and its parent, Strawberries Holding Inc, on Wednesday filed for Chapter 11 protection in the U.S. Bankruptcy court in Delaware.

In court papers the companies listed assets of $79.6 million and liabilities of $76.9 million, including $18.4 million in fixed liquidated unsecured debt, most of it trade debt, and $62.0 million in fixed liquidated secured debt.
The closely held secured debt is primarily senior bank debt and debt related to senior secured notes, court papers say.

This is the first Chapter 11 bankruptcy to be filed in Delaware since the chief judge of the U.S. District Court last month reversed a 25 year standing order allowing the chief judge of the bankruptcy court to assign new filings. Whether the new policy will affect what has been considered a debtor- friendly jurisdiction has been a much debated subject among companies and their lawyers.
The Strawberries Inc petitions have been assigned to District Court Judge Roderick McKelvie.

Strawberries Inc is a Milford, Massachusetts based distributor of audio and visual software with operations in the six New England states, Virginia, Pennsylvania, Maryland and the District of Columbia.
It is wholly owned by Strawberries Holding Inc, which is controlled by Castle Harlan Partners II, LP, court papers say.

Strawberries Inc chief executive Ivan Lipton told Reuters, "We've suffered a liquidity crisis brought on in the last couple of years by problems in the music industry including increased competition and weakened profit margins."
Lipton said the company would reorganize by closing unprofitable stores and has recently reduced the number of stores from 146 to 133.
